Power_Measurement_Reset_Min_and_Max_Meas.title: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Power_Measurement_Reset_Min_and_Max_Meas.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

Power_Measurement_Min_Measured_active_po.title: Min Measured active power
Power_Measurement_Min_Measured_active_po.description: The minimum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

Power_Measurement_Max_Measured_active_po.title: Max Measured active power
Power_Measurement_Max_Measured_active_po.description: The maximum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

Power_Measurement_Min_Range_active_power.title: Min Range active power
Power_Measurement_Min_Range_active_power.description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

Power_Measurement_Max_Range_active_power.title: Max Range active power
Power_Measurement_Max_Range_active_power.description: The maximum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

Power_Measurement_Cumulative_active_powe.title: Cumulative active power
Power_Measurement_Cumulative_active_powe.description: The cumulative active power since the last cumulative energy reset or device start.

Power_Measurement_Active_Power_Calibrati.title: Active Power Calibration
Power_Measurement_Active_Power_Calibrati.description: Request an active power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

Power_Measurement_Min_Measured_reactive_.title: Min Measured reactive power
Power_Measurement_Min_Measured_reactive_.description: The minimum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

Power_Measurement_Max_Measured_reactive_.title: Max Measured reactive power
Power_Measurement_Max_Measured_reactive_.description: The maximum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

Power_Measurement_Min_Range_reactive_pow.title: Min Range reactive power
Power_Measurement_Min_Range_reactive_pow.description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

Power_Measurement_Max_Range_reactive_pow.title: Max Range reactive power
Power_Measurement_Max_Range_reactive_pow.description: The maximum reactive power that can be measured by the sensor.

Power_Measurement_Cumulative_reactive_po.title: Cumulative reactive power
Power_Measurement_Cumulative_reactive_po.description: The cumulative reactive power since the last cumulative energy reset or device start.

Power_Measurement_Reactive_Power_Calibra.title: Reactive Power Calibration
Power_Measurement_Reactive_Power_Calibra.description: Request a reactive power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

Power_Measurement_Power_factor.title: Power factor
Power_Measurement_Power_factor.description: If applicable, the power factor of the current consumption.

Power_Measurement_Current_Calibration.title: Current Calibration
Power_Measurement_Current_Calibration.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Power_Measurement_Application_Type.title: Application Type
Power_Measurement_Application_Type.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string depending on the use case.

Power_Measurement_Timestamp.title: Timestamp
Power_Measurement_Timestamp.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed.

Power_Measurement_Fractional_Timestamp.title: Fractional Timestamp
Power_Measurement_Fractional_Timestamp.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms).

Power_Measurement_Measurement_Quality_In.title: Measurement Quality Indicator
Power_Measurement_Measurement_Quality_In.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

Power_Measurement_Measurement_Quality_Le.title: Measurement Quality Level
Power_Measurement_Measurement_Quality_Le.description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.
